description: From Middle English *malevolent (suggested by Middle English malevolence), from Old French malivolent and  Latin malevolentem, from male (“badly, wrongly”) + volens (“willing, wishing”), from velle (“to wish”).

adjectives.description: malevolent (comparative more malevolent, superlative most malevolent)

entries.meaning: Having or displaying ill will; wishing harm on others.
Having an evil or harmful influence.
